title: Environmental Management Practice through Dissolved Oxygen (DO) Control Optimization in Wastewater Treatment Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of wastewater treatment processes, foundational concepts of control systems, and knowledge of environmental regulations and standards.
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course for industrial facility managers/education officers, integrating environmental safety protocols and economic efficiency considerations from industrial settings

learning_goals: Explain the core concepts of dissolved oxygen (DO) control in wastewater treatment processes and analyze their relationship with environmental regulatory standards.
Understand the application principles of fuzzy logic and online Q-learning-based intelligent control methods and utilize them in designing sustainable environmental management systems.

Within a week, learners analyze three DO (dissolved oxygen) concentration tracking control simulation cases, accurately measure at least two of the three control performance indicators (error rate, response time, stability), and document results in an environmental management report format.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
